books.description: The evolutionary biologists posit that the modern world is out of sync with our ancient brains and bodies. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A HUNTER-GATHERER'S GUIDE TO THE 21ST CENTURY

books.author: Anderson Cooper and Katherine Howe
books.contributor: by Anderson Cooper and Katherine Howe
books.description: The CNN host and descendent of the Vanderbilt family charts the rise and fall of this American dynasty. Read by Anderson Cooper. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: VANDERBILT

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: Gabrielle Union with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.contributor: by Gabrielle Union with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.description: The actress shares some of the challenges and changes she has faced in recent years. Read by the author. 8 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: YOU GOT ANYTHING STRONGER?

books.author: Norm Macdonald
books.description: The late comedian’s tales of his life on a farm in Canada, sports betting and time in Hollywood. Read by Tim O’Halloran and the author. 7 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BASED ON A TRUE STORY

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Mark R. Levin
books.description: The Fox News host gives his take on the Green New Deal, critical race theory and social activism. Read by Jeremy Lowell and the author. 9 hours, 46 minutes unabridged.
books.title: AMERICAN MARXISM

books.author: Craig Whitlock
books.description: An investigative reporter for The Washington Post gives an account of how three successive presidents and their military commanders handled America’s invasion of Afghanistan after 9/11. Read by Dan Bittner. 9 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE AFGHANISTAN PAPERS

books.author: Anna Lembke
books.description: The medical director of Stanford Addiction Medicine explores the neuroscience and behaviors that inform the relationship between pleasure and pain. Read by the author. 6 hours, 11 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DOPAMINE NATION

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Barack Obama
books.description: In the first volume of his presidential memoirs, Barack Obama offers personal reflections on his formative years and pivotal moments through his first term. Read by the author. 29 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A PROMISED LAND

books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
